items.title: OnePlus launches US preorders for the $899.99+ OnePlus 15 after receiving FCC clearance, which had been delayed due to the US government shutdown (Dominic Preston/The Verge)
items.summary:
Dominic Preston / The Verge:
OnePlus launches US preorders for the $899.99+ OnePlus 15 after receiving FCC clearance, which had been delayed due to the US government shutdown  —  ﻿The phone starts at $899.99. … OnePlus has launched its delayed US preorders for the flagship OnePlus 15, almost a month after the phone was revealed.

items.title: TikTok rolls out a ‘Nearby’ feed to display local content in select countries
items.summary: While TikTok is already known for its recommendation algorithm, which is able to target users with highly personalized content, the addition of a Nearby feed gives it the ability to display even more relevant content to its users.

items.title: Meta reportedly plans to slash Metaverse budget by up to 30%
items.summary: The proposal reflects the overall lack of interest in products like Meta's social virtual reality platform Horizon Worlds.

items.title: US signs pact with Kenya under 'America First' global health plan
items.summary: WASHINGTON, Dec 4 - The U.S. will provide more than $1.6 billion to Kenya's health system under a new five-year agreement signed on Thursday, the first such agreement reached under the Trump administration's overhaul of foreign aid. Read full story

items.title: UK sanctions Russian intelligence agency GRU over Novichok poisoning
items.summary: LONDON, Dec 4 (Reuters) - Britain on Thursday announced new sanctions against Russia, including the entire GRU military intelligence agency that was singled out in a UK public inquiry into the 2018 death of a woman poisoned by the nerve agent Novichok. Read full story

items.title: AI chatbots can be wooed into crimes with poetry
items.summary: It turns out my parents were wrong. Saying "please" doesn't get you what you want-poetry does. At least, it does if you're talking to an AI chatbot. That's according to a new study from Italy's Icaro Lab, an AI evaluation and safety initiative from researchers at Rome's Sapienza University and AI company DexAI. The findings […]

items.title: OnePlus 15 launches US preorders after delayed FCC clearance
items.summary: OnePlus has launched its delayed US preorders for the flagship OnePlus 15, almost a month after the phone was revealed. The company has been able to start taking orders after receiving FCC clearance for the device — initially held back because of the government shutdown. The OnePlus 15 starts from $899.99 for 12GB of RAM and […]

items.title: Boost your AirTag’s battery life to 5 years with this waterproof case.
items.summary: Elevation Lab has announced a smaller version of its TimeCapsule battery-boosting case for the Apple AirTag. It’s about half the size of the original and uses a pair of smaller AAA batteries instead of AAs so the AirTag’s battery life is extended to five years instead of 10. It’s available now through the company’s website […]

These EV charging solutions normally fetch $569 at full price, with the Sierra Blue model keeping to its $398 low since early Black Friday sales, while the Wood Grain model is hitting this new low price here today in post-event savings.

items.title: Save up to 50% on EcoFlow’s latest RAPID power banks and 25W MagSafe models from $55 (Extra 10% off orders of $100)
items.summary:
Running alongside its ongoing Cyber Week power station sale, EcoFlow has launched a special Christmas promotion on its RAPID series of power banks, including its latest Qi2 magnetic solutions that were just released/launched for preorder, which gives you an additional 10% savings when your cart’s order totals $100 or more (with a continuing 5% code available for orders under that amount). If you’re not seeking to buy multiple units to reach that savings threshold, things start with EcoFlow’s RAPID Pro 20,000mAh 230W Power Bank with a built-in 100W cable at $125.99 shipped, after using the code XMASPB10 at checkout, beating its Amazon pricing by $14. Normally going for $180 at full price since hitting the market in later summer, discounts have mostly kept costs above $140, though we did see more recent falls to $130 and the $120 low since October. If you missed that low Black Friday pricing, you’re getting the next-best rate here this month with a combined $54 cut from the tag. Head below to check out the full lineup of power bank deals that you can pick up for your holiday gifts.

items.title: Turkey summons Ukrainian, Russian envoys over Black Sea attacks

items.summary:
Today only, as part of its Holiday Deals of the Day offers, Best Buy is offering Alienware’s 32-inch QHD 180Hz curved gaming monitor for $229.99 shipped. This already affordable, value-packed model typically goes for $320, so you’re looking at a $90 discount on it today. The 27-inch variant of this monitor that’s frequently discounted at Amazon has gone for less in the past, but this is the lowest price we have tracked for this 32-inch model that’s only available at Best Buy and Dell’s online store, where it’s currently going for $250. Best Buy’s offer, in comparison, is delivering an additional $20 discount today, so be sure to snag it while you can after getting more details below.

items.summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The flood situation in PERLIS continues to improve, with the number of evacuees sheltering at two relief centres (PPS) in Padang Besar and Arau dropping to 115 people as of 8pm on Thursday night, down from 186 in the afternoon. Read full story

items.title: Tunisian opposition leader Chebbi arrested as crackdown escalates
items.summary: TUNIS, Dec 4 (Reuters) - Tunisian police on Thursday arrested top opposition figure Nejib Chebbi to enforce a 12-year jail term on a conviction for conspiracy, his family said, the latest sign of an escalating crackdown on political dissent by President Kais Saied. Read full story

items.title: Wild $1,100 discount strikes Samsung’s 2025 27-inch 3D 4K Odyssey gaming monitor at $900 today (All-time low)
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Cyber Week sale event, Samsung is offering its latest 27-inch Odyssey G90XF 4K 165Hz 3D gaming monitor for $899.99 shipped once you enter promo code SAMSUNG3D during checkout. This monitor launched in April at $2,000 and has rarely fallen below $1,500 since. It’s currently $1,524 on Amazon, but Samsung’s promo code saves you a massive 55%, knocking $1,100 off its usual going rate. We saw this code briefly pop up a couple of months ago in October before disappearing, and now it’s back with an even bigger discount. This is the lowest price we’ve seen for this model and it’s – quite frankly – a wildly low discounted price for this display that likely won’t stick around for long this time as well. Grab it while you can after getting more details below.

items.summary:
While it might be Metroid Prime 4 release day, today’s game roundup is actually focusing on one game, and that one game happens to be attached to the most popular console of the year – the Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World console bundle is still on sale at the Cyber Monday price. Both Amazon and Walmart have units in-stock and down at $449, or $50 off the list price. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this console in terms of a straight up cash discount and effectively the only deal we have tracked outside of the gift card action. If you’re looking to get a new Nintendo Switch 2 under the tree this year, this might very well be your only chance to score one at a discount. 

  • Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $449 (Reg. $499) | Amazon
  • Nintendo Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle $449 (Reg. $499) | Walmart

items.title: SITE NEWS: How to contact Techmeme about news
items.summary:
Given that our contact points have evolved over the years, here's a general update on how best to tip us, advise us, or complain to us about news. This post is organized around several scenarios, which I'll list in bold.

You want to send an announcement just as an FYI to Techmeme: In the typical scenario, in which you think Techmeme is unlikely to feature the news, or you're not familiar with our criteria for posting, it's best not to do anything. Techmeme only posts about 50 headlines per day and any given announcement is very unlikely to be featured. So save us both time and focus on more fruitful channels than Techmeme.

You want to send news to Techmeme that you think there's a good chance we'll want to post: If you're familiar with Techmeme and anticipate we'll be interested in the story, you can tip the link using this online form. This form integrates into editors' workflow so human editors will see the link in real time. As a bonus, the form requests an email address, enabling us to notify you if we do post the link. For the (hopefully rare) bad actor out there, I need to stress that all submissions are fully vetted by human editors, so any spamming attempt will silently fail.

You want to add a social link underneath news that is already featured on Techmeme: We often feature related blog posts and social posts from LinkedIn, X, Bluesky, Threads, and Mastodon beneath our headlines, and you are encouraged to contribute these links. Just hover over the headline on our desktop page and click the "Add Link Here" button that appears. (For an example, see the image below.) As long as the link you submit adds value in some way, we will add it, and you'll get an email confirming this once we do. Feel free to tip your own links or links from your company, clients, or friends. As long as the link makes Techmeme better, it's a win/win for you and us. (Once again, I must stress that for the rare bad actor, all submissions are fully vetted, and spammy links will not make it to Techmeme.)


You are briefing publications on embargoed news and want to let Techmeme know: Larger companies often give us a heads-up on major announcements, because it helps us post as soon as possible after the embargo and arrange more comprehensive coverage. Because embargoed news isn't public yet, there's no link for it, so you can't submit via our online form. So instead, you can submit details via this special email address. To ease the process for both companies and Techmeme, our policy is to automatically accept embargoed information sent to this email address, meaning we won't publish any information sent to us until it's public. So please don't start off by asking if we accept. Yes, we accept, and have handled embargoes from the biggest tech companies for over a decade without incident. When you email, please include as much detail as you can, including the embargo time, any blog posts or press releases, and specifics on the publications you've briefed. Note that this email address will reach a person who then routes the news to a limited set of editors. (It is not an alias that simply forwards to all editors.) Because of this we request you email 12 or more hours before the embargo time if possible.

Techmeme posted something erroneous or misleading and you want to let us know: Occasionally we flub a headline, or mention a detail from a story that was later corrected unbeknownst to us. In scenarios like this, we definitely want to know so we can fix our headline, or, less commonly, remove or replace our headline, so please use this email address to reach us. Note that you can also use this email address for sending other information or even news tips that can't easily be conveyed by a single URL (making it hard to use this form.) Please note that while we always read these emails, in many cases, we don't have time to reply.

As a bonus, here are a few non-editorial scenarios for contacting us: to place ads on Techmeme, email us here, to inquire about our media monitoring and summary services, email us here, and for matters unrelated to all of the above, use this email address.
